note: Scores are updated with each new data package. Scale: 0% = no data / falsified, 100% = reproducible with controls, falsifiable, pre-registered.

claims.name: GKSL as Stage-I proxy
claims.desc: Lindblad open-system formalism correctly interpolates between coherent and diffusive regimes on biological graphs.
claims.evidence: 518K trials across 6 disorder levels without numerical artifacts. CTRW ≡ 0 everywhere (9600 trials). Clear GKSL vs classical separation.
claims.gap: Alternative wave proxies (telegraph equation) not yet tested.

claims.name: Two-factor mechanism
claims.desc: Stage-I efficiency depends on the interaction of partial coherence and graph topology.
claims.evidence: Confirmed on 3 model organisms + 100 HCP subjects. Rewiring controls attenuate the effect. CTRW anti-baseline decisive.
claims.gap: No experimental confirmation. Small effect on some dense graphs.

claims.name: Disorder-enhanced selectivity (DES)
claims.desc: Moderate disorder ε improves target selectivity via inverted-U, suppressing distractor paths more than target paths.
claims.evidence: Works on micro-connectomes (Drosophila, C. elegans). On human DTI: DES = 56% topology + 26% weight-specific (p=0.002). 90% of subjects show DES at ε=1–2.
claims.gap: No DES on dense macro-connectomes. Scale-dependent boundary unclear.

claims.name: ENAQT window (inverted-U in κ)
claims.desc: There exists an optimal dephasing rate κ* that maximizes transport to targets — neither fully coherent nor fully classical.
claims.evidence: 7-point κ grid + ICC fix + CTRW null. Inverted-U confirmed in 91/100 HCP subjects and all 3 model organisms. Rock-solid.
claims.gap: Single DTI modality. No experimental dephasing manipulation.

claims.name: Topology dependence
claims.desc: ENAQT gain depends on native connectome topology — degree-preserving weight shuffle destroys the advantage in gating circuits.
claims.evidence: T2 (gating): ΔG = +0.51–0.57, d = 1.2–1.5. T3 (relay): ΔG ≈ 0. Mechanistic predictors M2/M5 identified. Surrogate controls + betweenness-freeze.
claims.gap: M2/M5 causal link not tested by direct intervention.

claims.name: ENAQT in human connectomes
claims.desc: Environment-assisted transport operates on macro-scale DTI connectomes, not only micro-connectomes.
claims.evidence: 100 HCP subjects, 518K GKSL trials. Consolidated across P0–P4 validation blocks. ICC = 0.914 rank stability.
claims.gap: Single imaging modality (DTI). No fMRI/MEG cross-validation.

claims.name: Mechanistic hierarchy
claims.desc: Classical waves → 0% inverted-U; Schrödinger + dephasing → 72%; full GKSL → 100%. Quantum formalism required for complete expression.
claims.evidence: Telegraph batch (20 subj): 0/20 inverted-U. Schrödinger batch (100 subj): 72% [63–81% CI]. GKSL: 100/100.
claims.gap: Telegraph tested on 20 subjects only. Intermediate formalisms not explored.
